element.name: Transport Disposition
element.definition: The transport disposition for an EMS event identifying whether a transport occurred and by which unit.
element.v3Comment: Grouped with Patient and Incident Dispostions. Provides a rapid filter for transport or no transport for incident evaluation, business entry rules and Schematron rules.
element.v3Changes: Element added with the release of v3.5.0

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Transport by This EMS Unit (This Crew Only)

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Transport by This EMS Unit, with a Member of Another Crew

facet.name: enumeration
facet.annotation: Transport by Another EMS Unit, with a Member of This Crew

asserts.assert: Patient Arrived at Destination Date/Time should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Destination Patient Transfer of Care Date/Time should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Primary Method of Payment should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Cardiac Rhythm on Arrival at Destination should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit..." and Cardiac Arrest is "Yes...".
Destination State should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Destination County should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Destination ZIP Code should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
EMS Transport Method should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
EMS Transport Method should not be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Patient Refused Transport" or "No Transport".
Transport Mode from Scene should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Transport Mode from Scene should not be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Patient Refused Transport" or "No Transport".
Reason for Choosing Destination should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Type of Destination should be recorded when Transport Disposition is "Transport by This EMS Unit...".
Unit Disposition should be "Patient Contact Made" when Transport Disposition is a value other than "Non-Patient Transport (Not Otherwise Listed)" or "No Transport".
Transport Disposition should be recorded when Unit Disposition is "Patient Contact Made".
When Transport Disposition has a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting), it should be empty.

When Transport Disposition is empty, it should have a Not Value (Not Applicable, Not Recorded, or Not Reporting, if allowed for the element) or a Pertinent Negative (if allowed for the element), or it should be omitted (if the element is optional).
